title: Protectionism, Pandemic, War, and the Future of Trade - BCG
summary: Global trade is undergoing a significant shift, with rising tensions and economic nationalism replacing the globalization of the past few decades. The war in Ukraine has disrupted supply chains and forced companies to diversify their trade partners. This new landscape emphasizes supply chain resilience and global diversification, prompting companies to evaluate opportunities to improve responsiveness, prioritize resilience measures, and plan contingencies for at-risk supply inputs.
